fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.design

Interface IRouteContext


  • public interface IRouteContext
    Provides access to page routing parameters.

    Routing URIs may map to dynamic URIs; this interface provides access to both static and dynamic marker variables in such URIs, and may also provide access to additional generated or externally-configured variables.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Field Detail

      • KEY_ROUTE_CONTEXT

        static final String KEY_ROUTE_CONTEXT
        The key used to pass a reference to the route context in key-value collections. The value associated with this key must be an instance of IRouteContext.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IHttpAttributes.getCallAttribute(String), IPageProcessorContext.get(String), ITemplateData.get(String), Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_ROUTE_NAME

        static final String DEFAULT_ROUTE_NAME
        Implicit name of the default route.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAR_ROUTE_NAME

        static final String VAR_ROUTE_NAME
        Name of the routeName marker variable.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        DEFAULT_ROUTE_NAME, Constant Field Values

      • VAR_SOURCE

        static final String VAR_SOURCE
        Name of the source marker variable. The value will be an attachId of a data source.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAR_LIST

        static final String VAR_LIST
        Name of the list marker variable. The value will be a view name.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VAR_ITEM

        static final String VAR_ITEM
        Name of the item marker variable. The value will be an item key.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:

        static final String VAR_PAGE_ITEM_COUNT
        Name of the pageItemCount marker variable. The value will be a page item count.

        See Also:

      • VAR_PAGE_NUMBER

        static final String VAR_PAGE_NUMBER
        Name of the pageNumber marker variable. The value will be a page number.

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • isVariable

        boolean isVariable(String name)
        Determines if the specified name corresponds to a variable defined in this route context. A variable can be defined via user input or via a marker variable in a URI.

        Variables need to be validated every time they are input into the application.

        Parameters:
        name - the non-null name of the variable.
        Returns:
        true if defined as a variable, false in all other cases (will notably return false if name is defined by a constant.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isConstant(String), get(String)

      • isConstant

        boolean isConstant(String name)
        Determines if the specified name corresponds to a constant defined in this route context. A constant must not be defined via user input or via a marker constant in a URI, it may only be defined by hard-code configuration values.

        Constants need only be validated when processing configuration information.

        Parameters:
        name - the non-null name of the constant.
        Returns:
        true if defined as a constant, false in all other cases (will notably return false if name is defined by a variable.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isVariable(String), get(String)

      • get

        String get(String variable)
        Gets a variable value (or a constant value) from the route context.
        Parameters:
        variable - the name of the variable to retrieve (either one of the default variable names, or a custom variable name).
        Returns:
        the value of the variable, or null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isConstant(String), isVariable(String)
